intro: Alonsoa unidentata, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, known for its unique and often striking floral structures. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with opposite, simple leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are cup-like structures characteristic of the spurge family. Alonsoa unidentata is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
